description.narrative: By 2020, the education system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to provide and facilitate gender-sensitive and inclusive formal, non-formal, informal education opportunities for adolescent boys and girls., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education and CP systems, NGOs and communities increasingly provide vulnerable girls and boys with gender-sensitive opportunities to realize their rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the education system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to provide and facilitate gender-sensitive and inclusiveformal, non-formal, informal education opportunities for adolescent boys and girls.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the inclusivity of the formal education system through programmes promoting adolescents’, girls and boys, retention in school, and by providing alternative non-formal and informal learning opportunities for out-of-school refugee children and children at risk of dropout.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021

title.narrative: Number of refugee child/adolescent girls and boys with access to non-formal or informal education opportunities(44340), Text
Existence of programmes for adolescent girls and boys to increase retention in upper secondary schools among the most vulnerable students (e.g. CwD, refugee children)(61252), Text

baseline.value: No nationwide programmes in place. An orientation programme to facilitate the transition to 9th grade has been tested, adapted by MoNE and approved for scale-up. An intervention programme aiming to in

target.value: 2020:A programme for adolescent girls and boys aiming to increase attendance rates and prevent early school dropout among the most vulnerable students has been tested and is ready to be implemented nationwide.

actual.value: 2020:MoNE officially adopted the School Orientation Programme into its annual plans to facilitate the transition to 9th grade and prevent drop-out. It is implemented in all upper-secondary schools in Turkey.
